Articles.Content:
My Interplanetary guide for Kerbal Space Program

Now im sure there are other giudes out there but most of them i have seen are written examples or diagrams and then on the other-hand videos are just people showing that they got to a planet but not explaining it. So i made this quick video for those who need help getting another planet, to be able to follow the guide all you need is a craft capable of getting to where you want to go and the Protractor mod

-IWSC

Note: in poll options, option 3 "do x to make it better" please post what you think could be added to improve it

Edited October 14, 2012 by IWantSumCrusha
Talk through it all and dont use any mods.

Talk through it all and dont use any mods.

mods as in the protractor mod or the actual craft? the craft doesn't matter, but the calculator is meant to make it simple. Not everyone can pick up when you have to burn in vanilla game. Thanks for the criticism, i may need to add annotations in the vid to explain everything
an explanation with just the vanilla version would be quite nice. i'll have to give the mod a try later though

an explanation with just the vanilla version would be quite nice. i'll have to give the mod a try later though

personally, i thinks it's easier to use the mod. it's not like it's cheating or anything, all it does is show you planets and your orbit position and speed. I could try to make a vanilla tutorial but i don't think i have the brain power...

wow...just wow... how you did that... thank you very much, gonna give the mods and your method a shot (its not like i got an option, for now the only objects i can get into gravitational SoI without problems are the Sun,Mun ,and Jool)

wow...just wow... how you did that... thank you very much, gonna give the mods and your method a shot (its not like i got an option, for now the only objects i can get into gravitational SoI without problems are the Sun,Mun ,and Jool)

Thanks very much
